Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Lateral Lymph Node Involvement in Rectal Cancer

Participants.evidence: Eligibility included patients with locally advanced rectal cancer.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with rectal cancer received total neoadjuvant therapy (TNT) followed by total mesorectal excision or watch-and-wait management.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates LLN involvement in patients with rectal adenocarcinoma.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was disease recurrence, measured over a follow-up period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed centrally, with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 324 patients, 57 (18%) had visible LLN (LLN+) on baseline MRI.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Disease recurrence in LLN was rare, occurring in 3.5% of LLN+ and 0.4% of LLN− patients.

Harms.evidence: LLN dissection was performed in 3 patients; 2 died of distant metastasis.
